text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
dot-com with one step chicken noodle
soup that's right I have a cold so I
really want some homemade chicken noodle
soup except the problem with that is
when you have a cold you don't feel like
making a soup so what I decided to do
since I had all the ingredients around
was compromise and make some homemade
chicken noodle soup while using the I
don't feel good and have no energy
one-step method yes believe it or not I
just dumped everything in a pot to see
what would happen and this my friends is
exactly what happened so what I did is
took a cold saucepan and I dumped in
some Rock cubed up chicken and normally
I would definitely use chicken thigh for
this but I had some breasts and I know
that's what you people usually use so I
went with the breasts and then to that
we'll add a small handful of raw pasta
as you could probably see I went with a
corkscrew shaped egg noodle here and I
know it doesn't look like much but as
you'll see a little bit goes a long way
in this and then we'll also go ahead and
toss in our aromatic vegetables which
would include some onions celery and
carrots and because I was going with
this possibly ridiculous I don't feel
good one-step method I make sure those
veggies were cut nice and small and or
thin since we're not going to do any
sauteing here and then after our veggies
we're going to do a little bit of
ketchup as well as the thyme sprig
because I have it right outside my
window
we will also season this up with some
salt freshly ground black pepper and
cayenne well that's good for e if you
got a cold you're definitely gonna want
to eat some cayenne and then last but
not least because we're obviously not
roasting the chicken and making a broth
from scratch we will go ahead and dump
in some carton broth but make sure it's
all natural and organic and really nice
quality and the one I use with several
of those things and then what my plan
was here was the place this over
medium-high heat and bring it up to a
simmer and then I figured I would just
cook it during occasionally until
hopefully it turned into something like
chicken noodle soup and I'm not going to
lie this came up to temperature I was
getting very pessimistic since it wasn't
looking too good but is they heated
through and started to simmer it got
even worse
man was it looking bad and no I didn't
even bother to skim I just didn't have
the energy although the official reason
is I didn't want to lose any nutrients
and by the way that's just a look thing
you don't have to skim foam
safety reasons but anyway what I did is
gave that a stir and reduce the heat
down to medium-low and continued
simmering stirring occasionally until my
veggies were nice and soft and tender
and my noodles were fully cooked and
then some this is not something you want
to dent a noodles in okay I wanted my
pasta fully bloomed and almost dumpling
like
and in to cook it did get nominally
better looking I mean I figured it was
going to be cloudy because we're putting
all these raw ingredients in and the raw
pasta but since this was the first time
I'd ever tried something like this I had
no idea what to expect so I kept it
cookin on medium-low heat and right here
my noodles were getting pretty close but
like I said I did want those noodles
soft so I let it go until right about
here I gave it a taste and decided it
was perfect so in case you're wondering
mine simmered for about 35 minutes total
but as always your results may vary
which is why you're going to test it not
only for doneness but also for
seasonings you are after all the Kevin
Kline if I was too sick to think of the
rhyme and then once I decided this is
cooked long enough I decided to finish
up with a little bit of freshly chopped
to tell you parsley in case some of your
wondering doesn't this make it a
two-step soup now no it's actually still
one-step I mean come on who you going to
believe me or your lying eyes so I
stirred in some parsley and gave it a
final taste for salt and then once our
soup is fueling and tasting exactly how
we want we'll go ahead and serve that up
and there's some hot bowls and then I
garnished with a little extra pinch of
parsley which helped improve the visual
appearance zero amount but I'm still
happy with my decision and as the old
saying goes looks like hell but tastes
like heaven so while the appearance
improves significantly from what we saw
on the pot this is still not really what
I would call beautiful or maybe even
appetizing but here's the good news this
tasted way better than it should have
believe it or not this tasted exactly
like a really good version of a canned
chicken noodle soup which kind of makes
sense because I remember seeing one of
those shows back when on how they make
cam soup and I'm pretty sure they just
boil everything and put it in the camp
and especially the noodles had the exact
texture of a canned soup which I guess
is good so notwithstanding it's
questionable appearance I was absolutely
thrilled with how this came out oh by
the way if you're new to cooking here's
what I want you to do I want you to make
this recipe exactly as shown and then
make it again but the second time I want
you to saute the onions in a little
butter just so you can taste why we
actually do that step so if I'm being
really critical that's the only drawback
of this one-step method I think the
flavor profile is a little better a
little sweeter if you do saute those
onions first
but anyway that's it one step chicken
noodle soup thank you for letting me
phone this one in if you happen to find
yourself in a similar situation I really
do hope you give this a try soon so head
over to food wishes comm for all the
ingredient in out tomorrow as usual and
is all we enjoy
[Music]
